</p>

<h1 align="center">PQClass</h1>

<p align="center"> Classification of Operation Systems and Browsers using Post-Quantum Cryptography Algorithms. </p>

## Data Collection

This project includes a script that records the data, splits it into flows, and collects the needed samples for the project.

## Project Structure

```text
│   LICENSE             - Apache2 License
│   model-runner.py     - Train/Test ML models
│   processor.py        - OS Agnostic network processor
│   README.md           - Current file
│   requirements.txt    - python modules list
│   sniffer.py          - Async python sniffer
│   
├───images/
│       cyber_ariel.png - Ariel's Cyber Innovation Center Logo
```

## Classification Method

We're labeling files and samples according to the following method:

```text
PQC:
0 - Not Using PQC
1 - Using Kyber
2 - Using ML-KEM

Browsers:
10 - Firefox
20 - Chrome

OS:
200 - Windows
300 - Linux
400 - MacOS

Examples:
222 - Windows / Chrome / Using ML-KEM
311 - Linux / Firefox / Using Kyber
420 - MacOS / Chrome / Not Using PQC
```

## Open Source Tools

For automating the browser's actions we're using [Selenium](https://www.selenium.dev/).

For sniffing the data itself we're using [Scapy](https://scapy.net/).

We run the models and analyze the data using [python](https://www.python.org/).

## Workflow

> [!NOTE]
> All the steps below take a few minutes to complete, so don't worry and be patient.

> [!IMPORTANT]
> To change the Key-Encapsulation PQC algorithm in Firefox, you must use an appropriate Firefox version, see further in [here](https://developers.cloudflare.com/ssl/post-quantum-cryptography/pqc-support/).

1. Run the automation script (`processor.py`) on each operating system, and wait until it finishes running - it will automatically create the corresponding directory.  

## Dependencies

- numpy==2.2.3
- pandas==2.2.3
- scapy==2.6.1
- scikit_learn==1.5.2
- xgboost==2.1.4
- selenium==4.31.0
- webdriver_manager==4.0.2

To install the required modules using pip:  

```bash
pip install -r requirements.txt
```

To cite this paper, please use the following:

```bibtex
@inproceedings{noam-and-eylon-are-the-best-2025,
  title={PQClass: Classification of Post-Quantum Encryption Applications in Internet Traffic},
  author={Marnerides, Angelos K. and Hajaj, Chen and Marbel, Revital and Dubin, Ran and Dvir, Amit},
  booktitle={ICC 2025-IEEE International Conference on Communications},
  year={2025},
  organization={IEEE}
}
```
